Irish: ,gd(ann) an, In Classical Irish the forms were "i"
column5: "an" – "i/in" when the following sound was slender
column6: and "a/an" when the following sound was broad.  In both Irish and Scottish

Scottish Gaelic: "quarrelling." gdCainnt in Scottish Gaelic is used as a noun only
column5: except in Arran where it is also a verb
